adrFormatAddress: 492 1st Ave., New York, NY 10016, USA

originalText.text: This place can actually rot in hell. Protect yourself protect yo kids do NOT let em go through that place!

text.text: This place can actually rot in hell. Protect yourself protect yo kids do NOT let em go through that place!

originalText.text: My autistic 6 year old daughter was removed from my home for DV (not child abuse) and placed here where she was being neglected and abused. She is non verbal, so she could not communicate with me on who was afflicting the abuse. She had numerous bruises on her arm, knotted hair and was losing weight (her school also confirmed with me some of the concerns they had with the way she was being treated as well in The Children's Center) this is extremely disturbing and disgusting. You don't remove a child from home to put them in a worse situation, especially a special needs child. This needs to be addressed. I wonder how long has behavior like this been occurring at this facility to other children who can't advocate for themselves. I spoke to 2 managers and they try to downplay the maltreatment my daughter was receiving here, but God forbid, if she was in my care and had bruises, I would be charged with child abuse. This place should be held accountable for what happened to my daughter. Whoever did this should be fired immediately and a police report should be filed because this is child abuse. For any parents seeing similar situations happening to their children, speak up. Record all conversations and names of persons you speak to and address your concerns with your attorney and the judge. Together we can make a difference.

originalText.text: The facility was nice. The lazy ACS POLICE OFFICERS didn't get up to open the door for me as the door was stuck. My baby came in and some didn't have back on and I took my baby back until they did.  It was nice and air conditioned and we took our temperature before going to intake. Waited 3 hours for 1 piece of paper to clear my baby but the nurse didn't even weigh her after her last checkup was in 7.2020; wasn't concerned about a 8 month old  gaining weightðŸ¤¯Overall good visit and a decent environment. Had a lot of help. Thank you Ms. PITTðŸ’œ

originalText.text: The following message is transmitted at the request of local authorities. At 9:47 AM, Eastern Time, a disaster of unknown type has occurred at the Childrenâ€™s Center Facility causing significant damage and failure to various power and communication systems in the surrounding areas. An immediate evacuation order has been issued for all residents within a 75 mile radius of the facility, and on-site military has been dispatched to provide assistance. Make sure to bring an emergency supply of food, water, clothing, first aid kit, flashlights with extra batteries, and battery powered radios. Follow local evacuation routes which have been marked by local authorities and only use one vehicle. Do not return to the warning area until the all clear has been given. If you are not in the evacuation zone stay where you are. If you are within the evacuation area and have no transportation locate your nearest police department or military officer. Do not use telephones or cell phones except in the case of emergencies. Stay tuned to local news media outlets for further details and information on this situation.

Many complaints have been given and the facility can care less. This is a childrenâ€™s center, explain how kids are better off with you people than their parents??
